documents.title: visit the david lynch exhibition
text: if you dare .
the caffeine-loving auteur has just opened an art show , the unified field , at philadelphia 's pennsylvania academy of fine arts , where he studied back in the 60s .

collecting 90 paintings and drawings from 1965 to the present day , the academy has released the above video of lynch wandering through the exhibition , which is as unsettling as you 'd expect : all mutilated canvases , black charcoal sketches of disembodied voices talking through off-the-hook telephones , figures with 20-foot-long arms and mouths fixed in silent screams .
if you 're in the area and you 've been sleeping a little too well recently , go check it out - it 's running until next january .

documents.title: the return of tim & eric
text: tim heidecker and eric wareheim made their name over with bizarre comedy series such as tim and eric awesome show , great job !

- surrealistic and silly comedies that took on the lo-fi aesthetic and general weirdness of public access tv and ran with it , pulling names like ben stiller , will ferrell and michael cera into their orbit as they went .
the guardian chatted to them back in 2011 - read it here .

but their new series tim & eric 's bedtime stories - which debuts on adult swim tonight - appears to amplify the undercurrent of creepiness that runs through their work , while doing away with the comedy entirely .
a collection of 11-minute shorts featuring names like zach galifianakis and bob odenkirk strike a dreamy and grotesque tone that reminds me they once noted chris morris ' jam as an influence .
as heidecker told creative loafing atlanta : it 's hard to compare it to anything else .
there are definite tones of david lynch and the show black mirror in england that we 're very into .
and then our own stuff and the coen brothers .
it feels a little bit like it 's a nod to them .
a little bit of horror in there .
looks pretty good , anyway .
if it 's half as memorable as eric 's major lazer video it 'll be worth seeing .

documents.title: detox rip
text: guns n roses ' long-fabled chinese democracy was a sort of byword for the endlessly delayed , will-it-ever-come-out ?
album before it finally saw the light of day in 2008 ( to a rather limp reception , one might add ) .
perhaps the good dr dre has taken note , as his very own chinese democracy - the long rumoured detox , which has been in the works since 2001 - has apparently been canned .
sometime aftermath producer dawaun parker revealed the album 's fate in conversation with rap show shots fired .
he maintains , though , that there is a record in the works , adding i feel like he 's going to wake up one day and say today 's the day and put it out . ''
in the meantime of course , dre 's been doing all sorts - somewhat overpriced , slightly-too-bass-heavy headphones beats by dre ; productions for eminem and kendrick lamar , among others .
the thing that 's intrigued me , though , is his proposed album the planets , which was rumoured to find dre interpreting the planets of the solar system through the medium of hip-hop instrumental .
one thinks of dre perched on a stool in his garden shed in the middle of the night , peering up at jupiter and trying to determine exactly how its snare should sound .

documents.title: all i do is win
text: apart from the obvious stewart/oliver/colbert triumvirate , the best us talk show host for my money is jimmy fallon , and one of the most compellingly watchable bit of his show is his regular lip sync battle .
last night , it was the turn of blake shelton and gwen stefani , who dueted on a near perfect take on lionel richie and diana ross ' endless love .
i mean obviously , they 're not singing it , only lipsynching , but it 's all about the performance innit ?
fave is still emma stone i think though , with a powerful and rousing take on dj khaled 's all i do is win .
kicks off 5.40 in .

documents.title: time for a bit of new music ?
text: here 's zhala - a singer from stockholm , signed to robyn 's konichiwa records , with a marimba-heavy new single i 'm in love .
some hypnotic hair-braiding scenes in the video , which was directed by roxy farhat , who previously did the video for the knife 's a tooth for an eye .
anglo-japanese trio kero kero bonito get remixed by danny l harle , of divisive dance music collective pc music .
( not quite sure where i stand on that pc music lot yet , but i quite like the fact they 're making everybody a bit angry . )
norwegian comedy duo ylvis follow up their song about the fox - you know the one - with a frankly quite difficult to follow song about tying knots .
it 's sort of the boy scouts as remixed by major lazer .

documents.title: more ghostbusters reboot speculation
text: how long have they been talking about a new ghostbusters film now ?
ages , that 's how long , but in recent months the discussion has at least moved from insubstantial speculation in the direction of something more corporeal .
in august it was reported that bridesmaids director paul feig was in the to direct an all-female take on the franchise , which would certainly be interesting .
anyway , ghostbusters co-creator dan aykroyd - in an interesting tie and baseball cap get-up - has been doing a bit more blue-sky chat , here with the belfast telegraph .
some big ideas being tossed around .
my whole thinking on ghostbusters now is it 's beyond just a sequel , a prequel , another movie , another tv show .
i 'm thinking now , what does the whole brand mean to sony ?
what does pixar and star wars mean to disney ?
what does marvel mean to fox ?
everybody , all of us on the team there now , the executives , the creatives , myself , ivan [ reitman ] , we 're thinking more in terms of what do we build this thing into in the next 10 years ?
just not another movie or another tv show , but what 's the totality of it ?
what 's the whole mythology from the beginning of their lives to the end of their lives ?
ghostbusters at nine years old , ghostbusters in high school .
big ideas .
what do you want from the ghostbusters sequel ?
personally i think the idea of an all-female cast is an excellent one .
what better way to get over the absence of bill murray that by casting , say , kristen wiig ?
women kicked ass in the original , of course .

reports us weekly : chad is just a complete jerk in the way he talks to her , and the way he talks to people in general . ''
i 'm going to let the shocking news that nickleback 's frontman might be a bit of a tosser sink in with you for a moment .
have a strong cup of tea and relive happier times .
